node.title: Daylight execution of Sydney lawyer 'amateurish' and 'shambolic', court told
node.description: Two men behind an "inept" plan to recover money from a Sydney solicitor prepare to be sentenced for their crimes almost three years after the 65-year-old's death.
node.content:
["The daylight execution of a Sydney solicitor has been described as \"amateurish\", \"inept\" and \"shambolic\" by barristers acting for the men involved.", "Ho Ledinh, 65, was gunned down at Bankstown's Happy Cup Cafe, in Sydney's south-west, in January 2018.", "The shooting was captured on multiple CCTV cameras.", "In April this year, 41-year-old Arthur Keleklio, who fired the gun, pleaded guilty to murder.", "His co-conspirator Abraham Sinai, 37, was found guilty of the same offence following a trial.\u00a0", "Sinai's barrister Mark Tedeschi QC today told the NSW Supreme Court there was no intention to kill Mr Ledinh, but to wound or cause grievous bodily harm.\u00a0", "CCTV showed the gun was \"clearly pointed down\" despite Keleklio having \"every opportunity\" to fire a fatal shot from behind, he said.", "\"It was an incredibly inept plan from the beginning,\" Mr Tedeschi told the sentencing hearing.", "\"The amateurish way in which it was done in a public place where cameras actually filmed the attack itself as well as numerous cameras filming the getaway ... (is) utterly consistent with a plan to wound or injure rather than to kill.\"", "", "
Lawyer Ho Ledinh was shot and killed at the Happy Cup Cafe in Bankstown.(ABC News: Mark Reddie)
", "The court was told there was no evidence Sinai supplied the gun.", "Mr Tedeschi said the seriousness of his client's involvement was limited to his knowledge of what was to occur and providing a method of escape.", "He said it could not be concluded beyond reasonable doubt that Sinai was a \"recruiter\" of Keleklio, no motive had been established and there was no ill will to Mr Ledinh.", "Keleklio previously told the court he received instructions from an \"unknown person\" to recover debt.", "He claimed he had no experience with guns and the weapon went off \"unexpectedly\".", "Barrister Paul Coady, for Keleklio, also said CCTV showing the gun pointing down \"strongly corroborates\" an argument the intention was to injure rather than kill.", "He emphasised the \"shambolic\" and unsophisticated nature of the crime.", "\"In some respects, Mr Keleklio was the dispensable party and that is made plain by the fact his identity was obvious,\" Mr Coady said.", "Justice Robert Hulme was told Keleklio's remorse was \"obvious\", but the judge noted a document before the court in which the offender said he was affected by drugs and was \"almost automated, leaving him vulnerable to his environment\".", "\"It doesn't sound like remorse,\" Justice Hulme said.", "The judge heard Sinai had\u00a0good prospects of rehabilitation because it is his first serious offence and his family history was \"exemplary\"."]
